alert.note: Alert for Merrimack (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 04 at 8:56PM EDT by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Merrimack County through 945 PM EDT... At 856 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Hopkinton, or near Concord, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and half inch hail. Torrential rainfall of up to 2 inches an hour. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Concord, Hopkinton, Loudon, Canterbury, Warner, Boscawen, Chichester, Webster and Pembroke. This includes the following highways... Interstate 89 between mile markers 2 and 15. Interstate 93 between mile markers 37 and 46. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
